Params: Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory667.jpg
Ayla stands with her painting in the middle of the street under the setting sun as the undisputable champion.
Ayla
Phew... It's finally over.
Stretching, she shows nothing but patience to the mechanoid who comes up to her.
Ayla
The winner has been decided, right?
Awakened Machine
In a way, I suppose. But our biggest problem has yet to be solved.
Awakened Machine
Has the Palette Clash brought you any joy, Ayla?
Ayla
It has!
Ayla
Thank you all for letting me participate in such a wonderful celebration of art.
Awakened Machine
Is that so? That's wonderful.
Awakened Machine
We're glad to see that there are humans who are as obsessed with art as we are.
The mechanoid before her has a body full of outdated parts. If awakened machines can grow old, this one must be an elder.
Ayla reacts accordingly and smiles modestly.
Awakened Machine
Aren't you going to ask us why we started this war, Ayla?
Ayla
I'm happy to listen if you're willing to tell me.
Awakened Machine
Hm...
Awakened Machine
So you wouldn't have minded getting involved in this war even by accident...?
Awakened Machine
Even if nothing you have done would matter, and the Palette Clash would keep going?
Ayla
I can feel your sincerity and obsession with art. That's more than enough.
Ayla
Unless my instinct were wrong, I would have made the same choice.
The awakened machine nods, satisfied, before sighing with regret.
Awakened Machine
Unfortunately, we can't offer you the title of art leader despite you being the victor of this war.
Awakened Machine
As compensation, I will do my best to satisfy a request of yours.
Awakened Machine
Name it. We can offer everything from Golden Age relics to prized pieces of Constellia's art collection.
Ayla
Ayla
I don't need any of those. I just want to ask you for a favor...
No matter what you say, Mark will not tell you what his earlier words meant.
Awakened Machine
Mark.
The awakened machine heading toward you is a prime example of retro-style designs.
Mark
Do you have something to tell the human, Milon? I don't think it'll work.
Awakened Machine
That's okay. If Ayla trusts this human, I'm willing to trust her judgment.
Mark jumps down from his seat like a sulking child and heads out to find other mechanoids from the same School.
Awakened Machine
Hello, human. Nice to meet you. You can call me Milon.
Hello, Milon.
(Tell him your name)
Milon
You're the Gray Raven Commandant, the human hero those Constructs speak of? No wonder Ayla trusts you so much.
Hero... is an exaggeration.
We didn't manage to get here because of one human.
Milon
...My apologies.
Milon
...The sage's brilliance has perhaps blinded me from the differences between our kinds way too often.
There's no need for apologies.
We can take our time to understand our differences.
Milon
Take our time? Hmph...
You have no idea if he agrees or disagrees with you. Milon immediately changes the topic.
Milon
Can you tell me why humans decided to get involved in Palette Clash?
(Tell him your mission)
Milon
I see. Humans do depend on our infrastructure to stay alive.
Milon feels different from the other awakened machines you have encountered. Perhaps he is a mechanoid related to the city administrators Cervantes left behind?
(Ask him about that)
Milon
Administrators? No, no. I was around Cervantes for a longer period of time, I suppose, which made me ruminate more than the others.
Milon holds up his paint sprayer. This is the only part of him that does not look out of date.
Milon
Someone has to think about these things, after all.
Dulcinea
Why...
Dulcinea
Why didn't you stop the Palette Clash, then, Milon?
Milon
Milon
Do you also think that art has stopped Constellia from running properly, Dulcinea?
Dulcinea
It doesn't matter what I think. It is an objective fact.
Dulcinea
I simply can't understand why you are all so obsessed with art.
Milon
We're different from how composed and logical the mechanoids outside our city are, aren't we?
Dulcinea
Milon
Sigh... You're one of the lucky ones, Dulcinea. I can feel it. Your program and your frame were designed after humans.
Milon
You've had the freedom most mechanoids envy since the day you were born.
Dulcinea
...No one should envy me...
Milon raises his rusty arm as if he did not hear her.
Milon
Guess, Gray Raven Commandant. What is my frame most suitable for?
Milon's body is a giant orb with limps attached. A large visual sensor is set at the center of the orb, blinking occasionally.
Industrial use.
Military use.
You were a chef!
Milon
Hm... It's worth considering. A bullet is a bullet, even if an old man pulls the trigger.
Milon
Would you like a plate of fried screws, Commandant?
Milon
As expected from a commandant who regularly interacts with mechanoids. You're correct.
Milon
This is an industrial frame best suited for fabricating and welding metal products.
Milon
There is no unnecessary design on this body to maximize efficiency and minimize cost.
Milon
I can tell from the eighteen-digit production code logged in my program that my creator must be very satisfied with their design.
Milon
A machine that lives and dies for one and only one job.
Milon
Whenever I want to try something else, this body will let me know how ridiculous my idea is.
Milon
These arms that are designed to hold welding equipment are too weak to swing a weapon.
Milon swings his arm to prove his theory. The low bearing capacity and the limited movement arc of his arm make him look clumsy and exhausted.
His designer must be a human from the Golden Age. Humans would design machines to spare themselves from doing the work they do not want to do.
It was not a problem, per se, but accidents like the Punishing Virus could change things in unexpected ways.
Dulcinea
You're a mechanoid. You could have considered modifying your body...
Milon looks at Dulcinea. You wonder if the blinking light from his visual sensor represents a kind of envy.
Milon
For a being like you, Dulcinea, modifying yourself means replacing your arm with a stronger or lighter one.
Milon
Would you remove your feet and replace them with tracks? Would you add unknown programs to your software to run them?
Dulcinea
Milon
Not to mention how hard it would be for most mechanoids to attain that. Working and suitable parts are rare in this world.
Milon
I tried blending in with others after I was awakened by the Sage.
Milon
I helped other mechanoids process metal in order to survive. After I had a place to settle down, I still processed metal for the sake of efficiency.
Milon
I joined the Church of Machina, and I was assigned to process metal because I was an industrial mechanoid through and through.
Milon

My program never stops reminding me that an industrial mechanoid like me can only process metal, is only capable of processing metal, and will always process metal until one day in the future when my core gives out...
Milon
Me, Mark, the mechanoids from other Schools, we're all bound by our designs.
Milon
We're on a stage that we didn't choose, performing a play that we didn't pick.
Milon
The humans are luckier than us. We don't even have a god to pray to because we're born to be tools, the least important props in this story of humankind.
Milon
Fate treats us more cruelly than it does humans.
Milon exerts himself to twist his shoulder in a way that he can place his sprayer near his visual sensor.
Milon
But we were lucky to run into Cervantes and art in the dark...
Milon
Only when I create do I feel my worth. I'm not just an industrial mechanoid who's disposable. I can dream of anything and draw anything.
Milon
Every machine, be it industrial, military, or even a road repairing bot, deserves freedom.
Milon
There are no restraints, no destiny. Even the most disposable mechanoid can express themselves with a canvas.
Milon's welding torch on his arm suddenly lights up, not as a fire of destruction but as creation.
Milon
Art is our answer. At least, that's what every mechanoid in Constellia will tell you.
This is the origin of Mechanical Art in Constellia. This is the soul of the mechanoids in this city.
It is the cry of freedom and an act of defiance against destiny. It is a pillar that connects all their dispersed minds at the bitter end of the world.
They obsess because they cannot live without it.
It seems that the General Staff was right. This city's relationship with art is not as simple as it appears.
And Ayla?
Milon
You're wondering what Ayla thinks?
Milon seems to have misunderstood your question.
Milon
She just asked me to tell you this.
Milon
I'm sure you have your duty, Commandant. I suppose you won't be able to rest until you have accurate intel.
Thank you for letting me know, Milon.
Oh, so Ayla also knows about the Schools?
Milon
She...
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory668.jpg
Ayla
I asked Milon not to tell me. Only you need to know, Commandant.
Ayla
That way, I am free to do what I have to do!
The temporary tents of WGAA have been set up on the field. More and more supplies are arriving in the meantime.
Ayla answers your question as she takes the storage boxes from you and places them in different locations.
Why?
Pressing a finger to her lips, Ayla seems a little conflicted.
Ayla
I feel like there's no way my art won't be affected after I learn about why they are so obsessed.
The Palette Clash is still going...
Ayla
Of course. They haven't picked their art leader, after all.
Ayla
And they're serious about creating art. More than I imagined.
Ayla
But Milon has mentioned that those will take place later. There won't be any more actions anytime soon.
Ayla empties a storage box, taking out a bunch of painting and sculpting tools.
If Ayla does not know why the awakened machines are obsessed with art...
Are you making choices out of instinct, Ayla?
Hearing that, Ayla stops what she is working on and turns to look at you with a smile.
Ayla
I want to try to believe them, Commandant, because they have souls, too...
You can feel the sincerity behind her smile.
Ayla
And you're here, Commandant, aren't you?
All your worries become butterflies immediately, flying freely under the light.
Even Ayla is getting playful.
Ayla
Ah! The theme of the first painting... is decided!
Ayla.
Ayla
Hm? Don't worry, Commandant. I'm going to win.
Ayla
No matter how many Palette Clashes they're going to launch, I will keep fighting until they approve me!
That's not what I was talking about.
You have never doubted Ayla's capabilities.
Milon asked me to give you a message.
Ayla looks at you while she unwraps the twine around her canvas. You decide to keep talking since she appears to be listening carefully.
Milon asked me to thank you on behalf of the mechanoids in Constellia...
Thank you for participating in our messy event.
Thank you for taking it seriously and doing your best to achieve victory.
Thank you for recognizing the Palette Clash. Constellia will always welcome you to our celebrations of art.
But it won't be as easy to win next time.
Ayla stops unrolling her canvas. What follows is a smile as bright as a blooming flower.
Ayla
We got challenged, Commandant! We'll have to do our best!
That's right... Wait. We?
Ayla
Of course! I have counted you in, Commandant. I wouldn't have moved so many things here otherwise.
No wonder there are so many storage boxes and tools...
Noticing Ayla's anticipatory gaze, you cannot help but nod.
Ayla cheers, and your station in this city has been moved into this tent.
Seeing how inspired she is, you expect to work alongside her imaginative ideas for a long, long time.
